tweets.text:
#WorldFishMigrationDay this year is a time to celebrate on the #RiverDouglas
After 300 years the barriers are coming down, hundreds of miles of waterways are opening up to fish.  Enormous thanks to @HelenLDix and @VitaminSNC instrumental in making it happen, you deserve credit. https://t.co/cuCheLRDTh

We‚Äôre so happy, our second NATIONAL NATURE RESERVE, well done and thank you to everyone who helped to make this happen @FriendsofSaltwellsNatureReserve @NE_WestMids @canalrivertrust @EnvAgencyMids
 and our amazing volunteers. 
WE DID IT, THANK YOU!!!!! Here's our best bits! https://t.co/UKkbTc2NjZ
Greenwashing at it‚Äôs finest, and the perpetrator of this obscenity? Why the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/KniMhKoCwV

Latest design images for the @EnvAgencyMids Holme Sluices fish pass at Colwick #Nottingham #WorldFishMigrationDay #trentgateway #rivertrent 

@EnvAgency @lte_catchment @JamesBevanEA @LoucresswellEA https://t.co/XMciUTTJKC

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN

tweets.text:
Our scientists have made a breakthrough in supporting the UK‚Äôs response to #coronavirus.

We can now use sewage samples provided by water companies to detect local outbreaks, even when people don‚Äôt show symptoms.

Read more: https://t.co/VlvDhIA8I9

#CovidSewageTesting #TeamEA https://t.co/rhsdlZLGYE

The #SLWP Beddington Incinerator üè≠ continues to breach the @EnvAgency permit. 

üì∞Report just published shows: On 4th Oct that the CO Carbon Monoxide went over the permitted limit with a reading as high as 4161mg/m3!

Turning it off for the rest of day went over daily average. https://t.co/1PeRqFxpuE

@oliverpitt @EnvAgency Believe it or not but, according to the data I have in front of me, @wessexwater wouldn't win, not even close.

Top of league Division 1. @YorkshireWater with a whopping 616,643 hours worth of sewage dumped into rivers in 2019 followed by @stwater with a hefty 272,518 hours.
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Time to launch the Shit awards ? @Feargal_Sharkey . Who dumps the most? https://t.co/Zod4fY9B51
Tape it off as an #envirocrimescene. Deep shame on @thameswater for that, and the @EnvAgency  @EmmaHowardBoyd crew for complicity https://t.co/g1Wu8fCPPR

We‚Äôre Eating Fukushima Radiation; Bloody Cancerous Tumors in Fish & Seafood
https://t.co/fboPaPAQh2
#NeverTrump #EPA https://t.co/RXCUwXP0qX
Got to agree, it‚Äôs crazy that‚Äôs the bridge that already links these two parks are not open to the public. https://t.co/YQ7IYDvDAc

With the support of a range of partners over the last decade we have delivered over 60 fish passage projects, proud to celebrate #WorldFishMigrationDay our wonderful #fish and #rivers @EnvAgencyNW @HeritageFundNOR @theriverstrust @LancsEnvFund @mhclg @The_MMO https://t.co/GQIxBicIEw

#WorldFishMigrationDay we're sharing our 2020 fish passes &weir removals.
Samlesbury - we removed a redundant weir on the Ribble. It has improved access for migratory fish &will encourage natural river processes&improve habitat. Completed in June by @TheWadeGroup &funded by EAFRD https://t.co/93j5BbS7QK

We're celebrating #worldfishmigrationday with some pics of the fish passes we've built to help #Tyne fish on their journey upstream to lay their eggs. Here's #Hexham fish pass @EnvAgencyYNE @N_landCouncil https://t.co/LD0d8S2EDj https://t.co/AItNTr66Hx
Catch our very own #TwaiteShad expert @charlescrundwe1 on this podcast for #WorldFishMigrationDay We hope it inspires you to #StepUpForFish @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/Wyw7LG1aP9

Today, to celebrate #WorldFishMigrationDay we are delighted to release this short film showcasing the project‚Äôs first weir removal!

Watch the full film hereüêühttps://t.co/XatLeAsulq 

#LIFEDeeRiver @NatResWales @EnvAgencyNW @visitsnowdonia @DwrCymru @LIFEprogramme @fishmigration

Your opportunity to block Hinkley power station Fish Slaughter at Public Inquiry
Urgent action required to respond to @EnvAgency's notification & make a representation by 27th October
For more info see 
https://t.co/YVuvHFcJJm https://t.co/bwL3ahADoi

@SarahKHolford @SE_Rivers_Trust @WandleForum @thameswater @Wandle_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency We've just launched this action for the Hogsmill https://t.co/pp3cUKl2jj, following on from the Thames earlier in the week. It includes the Wandle (and Beverley Brook). 
We want to see real-time sewer spill alerts so we know exactly what's going on, in public.

tweets.text: @EnvAgency Forget identifying outbreaks, what about stopping the water companies pumping raw sewage into our rivers every time it rains!? If it has identified Covid in sewage, stop letting @thameswater pump it in the river Windrush. Why aren't you stopping this?

In 2019 the @EnvAgency environmental award winners pumped 107435 hours of raw sewage into our local rivers. 

@BathEcho seemed to have missed that part. üßê https://t.co/JStRe6SjlE
